description: Try our easy to follow White Christmas Layer Cake recipe. Absolutely delicious with the best ingredients from Woolworths.
keywords: Celebration cake,Pescatarian,Seafood free,White Christmas,Tree nut free,Dec 2019,Raspberry,Sesame free,Baking,Layer cake,Christmas,Soy free,Vegetarian,Peanut free
name: White Christmas Layer Cake Recipe | Woolworths

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 180°C. Grease 2 x 20cm (5cm deep) round cake pans and line with baking paper.

Using an electric mixer, beat butter, sugar and vanilla until pale and creamy. Add egg and beat well until combined. In a separate bowl, lightly whisk egg whites until mixed then gradually beat into cake batter. Using a large spoon, stir in flour and milk, in alternate batches, until combined. Fold in cherries and raspberries.

Divide mixture evenly into pans and smooth surface. Bake for 50 minutes or until a skewer inserted into centres of cakes comes out clean. Cool in pans for 10 minutes before turning onto wire racks to cool completely.

Meanwhile, to make the shortbread trees, beat butter, icing sugar and vanilla using an electric mixer until pale and creamy. Add flour and cornflour and stir with a wooden spoon until combined. Press into a 3cm-thick disc and wrap in baking paper. Refrigerate for 30 minutes or until firm.

Reduce oven to 160°C. Line 2 baking trays with baking paper. Roll dough out between 2 sheets of baking paper until 5mm thick. Cut trees from dough, using picture as a guide, and place onto trays. Bake for 15-20 minutes or until light golden and cooked through. Cool on a wire rack.

To make the buttercream, beat butter, using an electric mixer, for 10 minutes or until light and pale. Add one-third of the icing sugar and slowly beat until combined. Repeat with remaining icing sugar, beating until smooth.

To assemble cake, trim tops of cakes, if necessary, until level and halve through the centre to make 4 layers. Place 1 cake base onto a sheet of baking paper and spread with 1/2 cup buttercream. Repeat with remaining cake layers and buttercream. Using a palette knife, spread top and side of cake with a thin coating of remaining buttercream so cake is partly visible. Decorate cake with shortbread trees and foliage. Dust with icing sugar, transfer to a cake stand and serve.
